number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												Shovel Knight is one of the best games ever made, period.What makes Shovel Knight so good?1. Music: The music in this game is absolutly stunning. Jake Kaufman did a amazing job on this sound track like his other works in games such as Shantea and Mighty Switch Force. Also Manami Matsumae, who made a lot of classic Mega Man music, made a few tracks in this game. Even if you dont like the game, it is near impossible not to love the soundtrack. 2. Level Design: Even in my favorite games, there is always a part or two that always make me wonder "Why was this made?" Luckily Shovel Knight does not suffer from this at all. Every part in this game is very well made and does not feel cheap at all. Whether you make a jump or not is all up to your skill. A few parts such as Propeller Knights stage provide the most challenge in this aspect. Those damn fans XD 3. Boss: Rarely do you see a game where every boss is heart pounding and unique. Shovel Knight again somehow preforms this very well. The Order of No Quarter, the 8 villians in the game, all have a different aspect and provide the player a challenge. Whether its the robot mech of Tinker Knight, or the phycotic fight against Plague Knight, no game has ever made boss battles so fun4. Basic Elements: Shovel Knight as often noted, takes insperation from many NES classics such as Ducktales, Castlevania and Mega Man. Some of these things are Shovel Knights down spike ability, which alows him to bounce of enemy without taking damage, and the side weapons. All in all every aspect of this game is near perfect. I dont care whether it is on sale on not, but this game is a MUST PLAYShovel Knight recieves a 10/10

												This is a medieval Mega Man game, but with some changes.The game starts of fairly easy and gets progressively harder.There are secrets, upgrades, items, mini-bosses and all that wonderful old school goodness!The pixelart is spot-on and the soundtrack is amazing.(My only complaint is that the running feels a little slow/sluggish, but that is by design and it works very well.)EDIT: The "Plague of Shadows" expansion adds a new character with new story and completely different gameplay. I highly recommend this game to anyone seeking a challenging and retro feeling game that has a kick♥♥♥♥♥soundtrack!

content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												I would like to get some things clear before i give the game my recommendation:- So many pitfalls near the end of the game. (2 of the knights use spikes or pitfalls to kill you with, personally very cheap way of killing you).- Not very challenging considering you have infinite lives (you just lose money, and there are not enough upgrades or enough costly ones to make it painful enough). However the checkpoint system they use is rather interesting and can add a layer of challenge that the game kinda lacks.- Some of the relics in the game are overpowered compared to the others (Phase locket can be spammed for invunability and the propeller dagger can rip most bosses apart in seconds)Despite what i said before, shovel knight is a very solid game with so much charm that you will need a shovel to dig though.

												Such a fun game. Lots of little secrets to uncover. Map like Mario 3. Combat similar to Mega Man. Uprgades akin to Zelda. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												This beautifully crafted game features:-Tight controls: my character moves exactly where I wish him to go. He does not slip and slide around.-Unique and challenging bosses: This is the element of this game that really REALLY makes me think of old-school gaming. Each boss has a patterned move-set that you must learn to advance. Each boss has a few moments of vulnerability, allowing you to strike out if you're quick enough. Once you defeat them, you will feel that sense of accomplishment (a la Dark Souls, and other old school games).-Challenging enemies: they're all different. Challenging, but not impossible to blast through once you learn their techniques.-Challenging platforming: from large gaps, to bouncing off of enemies to reach high ledges, to very narrow landing spots... this game has all of the platforming you could ask for (and more, which I will not spoil). -Fun music, old-school style midi/"8 bit" music. It was a pleasure to my ears as a child and certainly fits this game's atmosphere.-RPG-lite elements. Upgrade your health and magic, acquire new spells, acquire money and buy everything!-Rewarding and challenging exploration: Need I say more? If you want to explore off of the main path to the boss, you will be  put to the test. However, you will also be rewarded!-Difficult but forgiving gameplay: There are checkpoints. But you may choose to break the checkpoints to make more money and advance your challenge!-Superb price point. I would gladly pay more than what I did for this. I'll be getting my money's worth and more.9/10. Get it. Enjoy it.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Shovel knight came out today, and I could honestly say that I was really excited. I wanted to be challenged by something that was brutal, but more importantly fair. Shovel knight is based off of the early NES games like Zelda 2, Super Mario Brothers 3, Megaman, and lots of other games. Unfortunately, the game does not live up to the “Brutal but Fair”. There are moments in the game where I died due to something that was not in my hands. There were moments where the game throws some serious bull♥♥♥♥♥♥at you. Another thing that also pisses me off is the spikes. Sure it makes sense that I would die instantaneously if so much as a pixel on my body touched some lava, but dying instantly by lightly grazing a spike is a whole new story. Plus, combine this with the relatively poor variety in enemies; you have a recipe for a relatively average experience. And deep down that’s what Shovel Knight really boils down to.  Shovel Knight seems to snap out of the matrix though when we reach the boss battles. The greatest thing about the boss battles is that you literally have to “TRY”. There’s no lollygagging’ when you’re here. The boss fights are a true challenge, and every failure is caused because you made a mistake, not because of a cheap spike cop-out for lazy programming. Because I died very so often in the later stages it was really lovely to see a checkpoint system in this game. It works incredibly well, and it’s good to see that they chose this rather than a lives system where you have to start the stage over. Instead, your punishment is similar to dark souls, where you lose your in-game currency when you die. Like dark souls, you can go back and pick the loot back up after you die. Speaking of dark souls, this is probably the one game that gets the closest to being as fair as dark souls. You see, this game did what Dark Souls 2 did not. It brought clever level design, great boss battles, and some relatively fair gameplay along with an incredible soundtrack as well as a great over world and an amazingly simple but charming story. I would probably give this game a 7/10 if the boss battles weren’t so ♥♥♥♥ing awesome, but because of the boss battles, the diversity in stages, and awesome music and story, I give Shovel Knight an 8/10. You see there are games that try all too hard to be like other games, we saw this with Castlevania: Lords of Shadow and that game did not do it right at all. However, Shovel Knight may be something we’ve seen many times all those years ago, but deep down Shovel Knight knew what it wanted to be. Shovel Knight is a homage to old school retro gaming. The game is definitely worth your attention. Watch some gameplay videos on it; I’m sure most of you will find yourself buying the game.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Anyone who can appreciate 2D platforming games should play this; it nails every single aspect of its design.- Every gameplay mechanic is taught actively and without exposition, in a subtle but smart way. You don't have to read anything, you'll learn everything you need to know just by playing. Every single room in the game is engaging without being cheap.- The soundtrack manages to be BOTH atmospheric and memorable, with songs that both fit the theme of the level and feature catchy melodies - every single one. No game has done this so consistently before in my experience.- Every boss and NPC has a unique design. The color palette is bright and vibrant but not sore on the eyes. Each villager feels like a real person. The bosses are fun to fight against; they overwhelm you at first but you pick up on their patterns and beat them in a satisfying way.- It uses the Souls series death system: you lose money if you die unless you can make it back to the spot where you died on your next try. In my opinion more games should implement this as it's a great balance between punishing failure and rewarding consistency.- It doesn't overstay its welcome. It's a short and satisfying game you can complete in a weekend.If you read my entire post then do yourself a favor and buy this game.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Excellent experience. It is a bit short but you can adjust the difficulty yourself based on what items you use. The achievement challenges vary from very easy to things like beating the game with no relics, not dieing once, or beating the game without using any checkpoints.Positive: Gameplay is solid and nestalgic, Music is top notch chiptune style, Decent humor spread throughout the story, New Game+ offers more challenging gameplay, Boss fights are well thought out and each feels unique.Negative: Some relics are too powerful for their cost particularly the invulnerability relic, Campaign length is a bit on the short side clocking in at ~5 hours if you are very familiar with 2D platformers, Weapon and Armor upgrades seem to be negligable.Overall: 8.5/10Bug: I also should note that I found a small bug in the game. If your monitor is set above a 60hz refresh rate and you turn on the game's VSync setting the game's speed adjusts accordingly. This may be a G-Sync specific problem but it seems fairly unlikely. My GPU is an Nvidia GTX 680 on the latest beta drivers using the Asus G248QE with the G-Sync module installed.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												Playing this game at PAX was one of the best experiances I've ever had. Talking with the devs about the game while I play it. The second I layed my hands on that controller was the moment I realized I need to get this game.Yacht Club Games nailed it with Shovel Knight, taking elements of tons of different NES classics.The controls are smooth, the story is awesome and nostalgiac, and the combat (though sparking rage at times) is rewarding and a joy!Each map is thought out perfectly and holds some of the best game design mechanics I've seen since 1001 Spikes and Braid. They're also jam-packed with secrets, so keep an eye out when playing to get some loot!The power ups not only look awesome but are very powerful when used right!The soundtack by VIRT and the amazing 8-16 bit style graphics not only bring some nostalgia to mind, but also makes everything come togetherShovel Knight digs it's way into my heart! 10/10Note that next gen controllers feel MUCH better than 360 or PS3 controllers.

content:
Posted: January 14
												TL;DR - Love the game. If you like platformers and shovels, go buy.I've only played for 36 minutes at the time of this review, but from the 5 minute mark I was already in love with the game.Can I just say how beautiful the world is? The pixel style is so retro, and it reminds me of Super Mario World on the SNES. I've never played Super Mario World, but I have seen it's graphics and in my opinion Shovel Knight's are similar. It even has this cute little opening story about Shovel Knight and Shield Knight, which is honestly just adorable. The gameplay reminds me of Mario games, as I've played Mario ever since I was about 7. ( That's almost 6 years. ) It's a platformer game. I especially enjoy the ability to use the shovel to jump on enemies heads and bounce, or on bubbles to let you get to different areas in the game. Besides that, I love the shovel in general. I don't think I've seen any other game that uses a shovel as the main protagonist weapon... Ever.. Swords, bows, guns, magic... And now shovels! I can definitively say I've always been a platformer game perfectionist, which this game encourages. It has secret passageways  that you can get to with your shovel, to play games and get songs and earn achievements. Trust me, I'm aiming to get all the gold in the world by the end of this. I WILL LEAVE NO PILE UN-DUG!This game is already adorable, and I bet it just gets better later.

												I absolutely recommend this game for anyone wanting to get a blast from the past in the sense of the 8-bit era. This game is incredibly well made in everything from art assets to sheer gameplay. Add in a massive amount of upgrades and fun little items that you can use and you have yourself a recipe for something that new games sometimes lack, Sheer unadultered fun!Nostalgia aside and taking the rose-tinted glasses off and just looking at this for what it is I can tell you, not promise, but tell you that should you decide to buy this game you'll be in for a good solid couple hours of well thought through level design, Good characters, Amazing gameplay and a game that'll leave you wanting more.I would definitely recommend this to anyone and loved every minute of it.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												I'm blown away and in awe of this game.  After just playing through Specter Knight, I feel stupid spending over $30 for a game.  Why, might you ask?  This game is the most satisfying experience I've had with a game all year.  The gameplay is flawless, the soundtrack is amazing, the secrets are infinite, and the homage to old-school games is omnipresent.  I cannot recommend this game highly enough.  If you don't pick it up on sale in the next 12 hours, you are missing out on saving $5 which you will inevitably fork over later.  Game of the year.  Hands down.  Buy it now.  Un-F'n-Real!

Thank you Yacht Club Games for this great game and I hope for your future games have the same genuine feel to them like Shovel Knight did.

												Whenever you're feeling inundated by the ocean of mediocre indie games, you can look to Shovel Knight as a shining example of a fun, superbly-made game by fantastic developers.Shovel Knight takes the absolute best parts of the 8-bit gaming age (and amazingly, none of the bad) and combines them seamlessly together.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												Shovel Knight is one of the best games ever made, period.What makes Shovel Knight so good?1. Music: The music in this game is absolutly stunning. Jake Kaufman did a amazing job on this sound track like his other works in games such as Shantea and Mighty Switch Force. Also Manami Matsumae, who made a lot of classic Mega Man music, made a few tracks in this game. Even if you dont like the game, it is near impossible not to love the soundtrack. 2. Level Design: Even in my favorite games, there is always a part or two that always make me wonder "Why was this made?" Luckily Shovel Knight does not suffer from this at all. Every part in this game is very well made and does not feel cheap at all. Whether you make a jump or not is all up to your skill. A few parts such as Propeller Knights stage provide the most challenge in this aspect. Those damn fans XD 3. Boss: Rarely do you see a game where every boss is heart pounding and unique. Shovel Knight again somehow preforms this very well. The Order of No Quarter, the 8 villians in the game, all have a different aspect and provide the player a challenge. Whether its the robot mech of Tinker Knight, or the phycotic fight against Plague Knight, no game has ever made boss battles so fun4. Basic Elements: Shovel Knight as often noted, takes insperation from many NES classics such as Ducktales, Castlevania and Mega Man. Some of these things are Shovel Knights down spike ability, which alows him to bounce of enemy without taking damage, and the side weapons. All in all every aspect of this game is near perfect. I dont care whether it is on sale on not, but this game is a MUST PLAYShovel Knight recieves a 10/10

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												This title is fully dedicated to being a nostalgia-fest, while bringing new flair and finesse to the platformer genre.  A love-child to gaming of generations' past, taking a mishmash of elements from the tried and true classics to some more obscure titles. Elements range from Mario 3 to Duck Tales to Mega Man and Castlevania. A stellar soundtrack, striking visuals, an overall good feel. The controls are fluid, and the level design is challenging without being unfair, leading to most deaths being a result of poor player judgement. tl;dr I dig it.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												An awesome combination of Mega Man, Zelda 2, Dark Souls, Super Mario Brothers 3 and a few other games.  The game is funny and is in the Goldilocks zone in terms of difficulty. The only downside I would say is the controls.  My game pad didn't work with it, and only using the keyboard causes some of the keyboard lock-out issues.  A good fix would have been to allow mouse buttons for attacks.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												The best game I have ever played in twenty years of computer gaming, bar none (and I have played a LOT of games). Eight years on I can still recall how profoundly that game gripped me, and I am not an overly emotional person. You will care about the characters, you will be moved, you will make choices that tell you more about yourself. It sounds trite, I know, but it really is that good. If only someone would make more of these...insightful, intelligent, devastatingly creative. Fallout is the only RPG to come close. A word of warning: You MUST read all the text, explore all the dialogue options, if you are to gain the most from the game. A decent intelligence and wisdom score is recommended.....although so is a decent score in everything else....the game does the best job of making usually superflous statistics genuinely useful that I have ever seen. Still very much worth playing.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												Shovel Knight's the kind of game that would invite you to it's birthday party, then give everyone else a present.Shovel Knight's the kind of game that borrows five buck from you, then pays you back with interest before you have to ask for it back. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that has the hots for your sister, but asks if you're cool with it before he makes a move. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that creates a totally fun an interesting protagonist, but also has fun and interesting antagonists. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that were you both dying in a desert, would give you the last sip of canteen water.Shovel Knight's the kind of game that knows how to be challenging enough that you never lose interest, without ever getting so hard as to make you want to quit. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that when it drinks the last cup of coffee in the office, always remembers to brew another pot. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that hands out a few achievements for general progress, but reserves most of them behind actually difficult to achieve challenges. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that helps you with your math homework. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that apes classic late- 1980's NES game mechanics and structures to a T, while excising all the stuff that was annoying from them. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that will listen to your differing political views, but will still repect you and maintain your friendship because that's more important. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that calls back after the date. Shovel Knight's the kind of game that wakes you up with fresh coffee and scrambled eggs the morning after. Shovel Knight's the kind of game you should buy.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												This game floored me. Then dug me right back out. Seriously, this is one of those you-have-to-play-this-if-you-like-video-games game.Retro-gamers will love this game for its reverent adherence to the classic Mega Man formula, in both form and delivery; while any other gamer can appreciate this game for the amount of nuances not just in gameplay but in its tight controls, fantastic sprites and absolutely awesome music.Shovel Knight is a must-buy, I cannot sing higher praises or more praises of it, 'Nuff sed. Buy it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												The best way to describe Shovel Knight is it’s a cross been a good Mega Man style platformer with a Dark Souls death system twist.   It feels just like if you gave the Blue Bomber a shovel instead of a blaster, but kept nearly all the other mechanics and level design intact.  You gain currency by progressing through the levels, defeating enemies and finding secrets.  This is used to provide   upgrades, more health, and usable items similar of that you get from Robot Masters in Mega Man.  When you die, you lose a portion of your money in which you can get back if you can return to the same spot and recollect what was lost.  What is already in this game is well worth the asking price, and they plan to add more free characters and modes to an already great value.   If you like Mega Man games or even this style of 2d platformer, you need to give this game a shot!  I almost guarantee you won’t regret it!

content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												I am sure people have made all of the shovel/dig puns so I won't even dig up that corpse. Shovel Knight is a fun yet challenging game that will suck you into a nostalgia filled daydream of the SNES days. Shovel Knight will not only test your timing, jumping or shovel skills but also your patience and your ability to think critically while still enjoying a fun story with some dark undertones. Buy this game if you love playing difficult platformers or if you just love fun in general. What's great about the game, and Yacht Club Games is that the devs are still planning on releasing more updates to expand and improve the game so you can play as different knights. I will add that the badges for Shovel Knight look ugly to me, so I will be keeping my level one badge. I really dig this game. Yeah, I made that pun, and I don't care if you hate me for it.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												I wouldn't mind saying the pro's and con's of Shovel Knight but the only thing I rather say is if anyone who played the old school platformers will have a great time enjoying Shovel Knight. It has some parts from the original Mega Man and Ducktales. Taking a few things from it to bring out a pretty good game such a Shovel Knight is definitely worth checking out. Such as the music. From the title screen to the end game screen had some memorable music pieces. Even some tracks needs a little time to get a few plays before judging and considering to be a memorable track. As of what I know overall the music is great. The mechanics and controls are great as well including the story. From me it was something of what old school gaming once had and that is a good or bad story. If it doesn't catch your attention for its story, music, or its sense of nostalgia then maybe it should be worth checking out when the weekend rolls on by for a short gaming session.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												The best way to describe Shovel Knight is it’s a cross been a good Mega Man style platformer with a Dark Souls death system twist.   It feels just like if you gave the Blue Bomber a shovel instead of a blaster, but kept nearly all the other mechanics and level design intact.  You gain currency by progressing through the levels, defeating enemies and finding secrets.  This is used to provide   upgrades, more health, and usable items similar of that you get from Robot Masters in Mega Man.  When you die, you lose a portion of your money in which you can get back if you can return to the same spot and recollect what was lost.  What is already in this game is well worth the asking price, and they plan to add more free characters and modes to an already great value.   If you like Mega Man games or even this style of 2d platformer, you need to give this game a shot!  I almost guarantee you won’t regret it!

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												This game was amazing, just utterly amazing. I spent so much time playing and replaying this game. (Note: I started the game on PC but finished it on 3DS) There are so many great things about this game which I will name later. Most of this game was very memorable and enjoyable and I reccomend that everybody should play this game... but... WARNING: IF YOU DON'T LIKE DIFFICULT GAMES THAN JUST LEAVE!Pros-Amazing music-Fun levels-Creative bosses-Fun items to collect-Amazing Humor-Great controls -Most of the difficulty wasn't from ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥tCons-Controls are much easier on systems like the 3DS, Xbox, and Playstation-Some of the difficulty is complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t (For example: There are these enemies called Hover Meanies which are extremely annoying. They fly around and blow air that pushes you into insta-kill zones like spikes, lava, or pits. They're really annoying because most of the time, you have to memorize where they are or else they'll just come out of nowhere and suddenly you're dead)-Boss battles are pretty simple-In the Challenge Mode, you need the Phase Locket to beat it. (Phase Locket is a magical item that renders you temporarily invincible) I mean, you don't need it but it's like Borderlands 2 Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode and slag. The game is to difficult without it.-The Challenge Mode is the wrong type of challenging. (When I went into Challenge Mode, I expected something like slightly different level design, smarter AI, etc. but the challenge mode only makes it where you get no health restore stuff except for the rare carrot which only restores 2 health, and all damage done to you is doubled) -Most of the bosses were pretty easy (Except for the Specter Knight, The Enchantress, The Remnant of Fate) like literally all you have to do is bounce on them with the downward shovel attack.-The final boss (The Enchantress+Remnant of Fate) were more frustrating than memorable or fun. The Enchantress battle would be decent if it weren't for this insta-kill move where it would push you into the pit. The whole boss battle you fight on breakable blocks and she will fire a series of orbs that will break the blocks, sometimes she would fire them from above you and you couldn't jump out of it and you would just fall into the pit, and the Remnant of Fate just made it added this mechanic where (SPOILER DON'T READ PAST THIS) the Shield Knight would jump up and you had to bounce off of her Shield to hit the Remnant of Fate, which if you did it 1 millisecond early, wouldn't work, and it was often hard to get to Shield Knight because of the Remnant of Fates remaining orbs. Also she did a crap-ton of damage if you got hit once.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
Product received for free
												THIS GAME IS GREAT, if a little stressful at times. The music is amazing and the art style gives the feel of playing an old game.Money is a huge problem with my playthrough. Every time you die, a portion of your money is left where you died, so you have to go back to that spot, which may be very hard, get it, at which point youll have to not make the same mistake and move on. Sometimes the money is left at spots right above something that kills you, so you cant get it, or the money might just dissapear completely.The platforming is fun, and its satisfying when you find a hidden spot full of money.The bosses werent ridiculously hard, but it wont take you the first try to take them down.After completing the story with shovel knight, the challenge mode is unlocked (which i didnt find that fun) and the plague knight story was unlocked. Its almost exactly like the playthrough with shovel knight, just with a different story and different styles of fighting. The levels are the same, just with some more coins that plague knight needs to collect so, i wont be bothered with finishing this part.To conclude, i absolutely recommend this game. You will have a blast (for most the time, atleast).

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												A perfect throwback to the days of the classicsI just want to get out there that this game takes elements from mega man, duck tales, and super mario bros 3.  adds in some original stuff, bundles it together, and the product is shovel knight, the best indie game i've played in a long time.  The game was created by yacht club games, a group of former wayforward employees. Never heard of them? neither have I. I mean, they're an indie developer. let's get into the review.Story: Prior to the game, adventurers Shovel Knight and Shield Knight journeyed across the world alongside one another, but while exploring the Tower of Fate, a cursed amulet takes over Shield Knight and leaves Shovel Knight outside of the sealed tower. Grieving for his beloved, Shovel Knight gives up adventuring and goes into self-imposed exile. During his absence, the Enchantress rises to power, spreading evil across the land. Upon hearing that the Enchantress has unsealed the Tower of Fate, Shovel Knight begins his journey back to it, hoping to find and rescue Shield Knight. In order to do so, Shovel Knight must fight the members of "The Order of No Quarter," who have been dispatched by the Enchantress to impede him. Now, it's not directly stated in the game, but just about anyone can infer that shovel knight and shield knight really shared something special. i give the story a 5/5. A little simple, but it's entertaining enough. (& no spoilers for the ending.)gameplay- shovel knight allows you to control the blue bombe- i mean shoveler through a variety of hubs and stages scattered throught the order of no quarter. Each stage you complte hhas you face off against a knight of the order of no quarter. the eight knights are- king knight, specter knight, treasure knight, plague knight(who could forget his bendy straw) mole knight, polar knight, propeller knight, and tinker knight. There is also black knight, but he serves as shovel knights rival. Now, your main weapon is a shovel, but you can by relics and shovel upgrades to make yourself even more badassand to smooth out the ride. relics require magic, and you can increase your magic limit as well as your health. The gameplay definently reminds me of mega man's and the world map is practically ripped from super mario bros 3, with a hint of ducktales' fighting mechanics. though stiff controls can make platforming a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥sometimes. 4/5graphics- perfect classic interface. Character sprites and the environments in which they inhabit really stand out. 5/5.music- pure sex to my ears. 5/5.controls. shovel knight controls like a dream, though he can feel stiff at times, as metioned earlier. Best played with a controller, the keyboard controlls feel weird. 4/4All in all, i give the game a 4.5/5, it's pretty damn good.It's not just on steam, also. it's on wii u, 3ds, ps3, ps4, and xbox one for the same price!sequel????

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
I can't explain the feeling I get when I play this game. It is my favourite game to come out in 2014. While it only says I have 1 hour played I have been deeply invested in the 3DS version and just recently bought it on PC... Because this game is amazing.TL;DR  This game touches nostalgia hard. If you're a fan of games and want to know how game design works... This game will teach you how to do it right. I am just gushing over how good this game is. Go buy the game, even if you don't like it... Support these amazing game developers. Will recommend this game to my children, grandchildren and so on.Right so now that I've got the TL;DR down I will begin a little bit more indepth and hopefully a bit more constructive.The game is a throwback to the age of platformers on the NES. This means Megaman, Legend of Zelda 2, DuckTales and Castlevania. This is one huge loveletter to the series of platformers and it even goes beyond that.The game itself gives you short story that seems to have no bones to it, but reveals more when you progress further in the game which would assume they have more than just a single Shovel Knight in mind. The game puts you in the role of Shovel Knight. A knight that uses a shovel for a weapon. You fight beside Shield Knight, your love and trustful friend until she dissapears. Que Shovel Knight amazing music and you're on your way to save your love and partner. The game gives you as little instructions as possible in the forms of text, you'll play the game and learn about it automatically ISN'T THAT JUST DANDY?! A thing of the past and yet it is the best thing to ever resurface, not having to see tireless textboxes shoved in there.After the first level you are thrust into an overworld like Super Mario Bros 3, where there are different icons. There will be icons for all kinds of nifty things but also the icons for the areas and bosses you will need to defeat to progress through Shovel Knight. In these levels you will collect treasure and be ready to grab everything you can because these will allow you to buy upgrades. We're talking about more health, manapoints... How about a new armor that does something different? Or how about an armour that makes you sparkle so you can go on your quest looking like the dandiest of knights there are!?Your shovel will also attain upgrades as you proceed to buy and collect treasure and soon you will find yourself at a boss.The bosses are like megaman, 9 bosses, 8 knights and the dreaded enchantress! + your rival Black Knight. These bosses are a delight, everyone with a deep personality that makes them feel way cooler than just having a skin and a theme. These bosses all have a purpose they want to fulfill and a reason to be in the ORDER OF NO QUARTER!*Echoing begins*Every boss has their own stage, themed appropriately aswell, their own music for the level and boss tune which are all delightful and will without a doubt make your feet tap and your skin crawl with how good it is... They even have the composer for Megaman in on this!Now that we've got all the positive stuff on here I would love to talk about something that really didn't bother me, but may bother some.There is knockback and insta-kill pits.NOT TO WORRY! There is a checkpoint system, but I know it can be a bit troubling for some. Just try your best guys! Some of the armors are a bit meh and found myself only using one particular one through the whole game.Other then that there really isn't anything else to say... It's just a gem that needs to stay for more games.Oh... Did I forget they're giving us Free DLC!? Where we play as one of the other knights? And they'll do it for more. Completely new combat, new enemy placements and so on so forth. FOR FREE FOR FREEEEEE. Please guys. I beg of you, buy this game and support these game developers since they're doing all this RIGHT! NOW! STEEL THY SHOVEL AND FIGHT!

content:
Posted: March 8
												This game is excellent. So good. It's retro inspired in all the best ways. I love the story, the controlles and the pacing. Brutal challenges await as well. Everything that makes video games good is included. Ahhhh and don't forget the stunning 8-bit style soundtrack—so good!If you're having any trouble getting your controller recognized make sure you go in to Steam's Big Picture mode, the controller settings and make sure all your controllers are enabled!

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												This game is an homage to classic 8-bit sidescroller action that we grew up with, it combines the best elements from Megaman, Mario 3, Ducktales, Metroid and others into an unforgetable experience.The game is just full of secrets that you won't find in your first playthough of the game.I cannot recommend this game enough, if you have $15 to spare, get this game. If you grew up with the NES, SNES, or Genesis, get this game, you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
												This is amazing. It takes me way back to the days of MegaMan (one of my favorite gameing franchises). It tries to be like MegaMan, and does it well. The level design is fantastic. Every level introduces something new. The controls are simple and good. I love every thing about Shovel Knight. But, I know what you're saying. "But you've only played it for a few hours!" Not true. I got this on 3ds back in 2014 and I've played it for 70 hours total.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
												Shovel Knight is a game that will make you angry. Angry that modern game design has summarily forgotten a whole slew of concepts it previously knew, which Shovel Knight displays in spades. Also it has an NPC who does nothing but spew puns, which might make you really angry as well.
